item.title: Plain Template
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Unid H4x0r, post:4, topic:203999”][quote author=Holic link=topic=269423.msg2214194#msg2214194 date=1209977872]
Too plain. Lose the drop shadow, that won’t exist in an actual functioning template.

…
[/quote]
It’s suppose to be a plain layout. Look: http://www.instantz.net/images/topsw8.png , they use drop shadow…[/quote]
In a non ugly-as-fuck way.
Ditch the weird shaped not quite rounded corners, along with the shadow. Try a 1px stroke or something. Use a subtle linear gradient or two, and change the green+blue so they don’t clash AND hurt your eyes at the same time.

Read full topic

item.title: Plain Template
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

I mean like you have it. It’s alright to have on something like a header, but if you’re doing a simple (not plain) template, then it means not all these effects and such. Plus that drop shadow is rather shitty.
Simple templates are meant to be image light, having drop shadow will require images.
Also, one thing I forgot to mention was the white background. Horrid. Less intense colours work better with white, but not a strong blue and green.

I’m not saying this is all that bad, it has potential to be better but in it’s current state, I really would work on it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@YupolaScape wrote:

The colours dont blend, the text doesnt go with the template and everything pretty much needs resizing. However, if a bit more work put into it it may look alright.

item.title: Plain Template
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Too plain. Lose the drop shadow, that won’t exist in an actual functioning template.
Fix the navbar, the text looks odd like that. I also don’t see why there’s a bar at the top, the fact that it’s bigger than anything there makes it look even more random.

This article could help you out a bit http://www.profitpapers.com/dev/web-20-design-tutorials.php.

Read full topic
